Class EZMQPublisher

extends java.lang.Object

      • EZMQPublisher

        Constructor for EZMQ publisher.

        port - port for publishing message/events.
        callback - EZMQCallback

    • Method Detail

      • setServerPrivateKey

        public EZMQErrorCode setServerPrivateKey(java.lang.String key)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Set the server private/secret key. Note:
        (1) Key should be 40-character string encoded in the Z85 encoding format
        (2) This API should be called before start() API.
        Parameters:
        key - Server private/Secret key.
        Returns:
        EZMQErrorCode
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws, if security is not enabled.

      • start

        public EZMQErrorCode start()
        Starts PUB instance.
        Returns:
        EZMQErrorCode

      • publish

        public EZMQErrorCode publish(EZMQMessage ezmqMessage)
        Publish events on the socket for subscribers.
        Parameters:
        ezmqMessage - Event EZMQByteData
        Returns:
        EZMQErrorCode

      • publish

        public EZMQErrorCode publish(java.lang.String topic,
                             EZMQMessage ezmqMessage)
        Publish events on a specific topic on socket for subscribers. Note:
        (1) Topic name should be as path format. For example: home/livingroom/
        (2) Topic name can have letters [a-z, A-z], numerics [0-9] and special characters _ - . and /
        (3) Topic will be appended with forward slash [/] in case, if application has not appended it.
        Parameters:
        topic - Topic on which event needs to be published.
        ezmqMessage - Event EZMQByteData
        Returns:
        EZMQErrorCode

      • publish

        public EZMQErrorCode publish(java.util.List<java.lang.String> topics,
                             EZMQMessage ezmqMessage)
        Publish an events on list of topics on socket for subscribers. On any of the topic in list, if it failed to publish event it will return EZMQ_ERROR/EZMQ_INVALID_TOPIC. Note:
        (1) Topic name should be as path format. For example: home/livingroom/
        (2) Topic name can have letters [a-z, A-z], numerics [0-9] and special characters _ - . and /
        (3) Topic will be appended with forward slash [/] in case, if application has not appended it.
        Parameters:
        topics - Topic on which event needs to be published.
        ezmqMessage - Event EZMQByteData
        Returns:
        EZMQErrorCode

      • stop

        public EZMQErrorCode stop()
        Stops PUB instance.
        Returns:
        EZMQErrorCode

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Get the port of the publisher.
        Returns:
        port number as integer.
